title: news.com.au — Australia’s #1 news site
text: Shadow Education Minister Tanya Plibersek says the economy is “crying out for skilled workers” and there is a “desperate” need for Australians to have more hours of work. TAFE spending is due to come under the microscope during Senate estimates after the federal government was accused of short-changing vocational education by $214 million in the last financial year. Labor claimed the under-spend was not a new issue and that the Education Department declined to spend close to a billion dollars in funding in the past five years. Ms Plibersek told Sky News “we’ve got skill shortages right across the economy, there are so many areas and we have a desperate need for skilled workers”. “We’ve got Australians who want more hours of work and the government has under-spent the TAFE and training budget,” she said. Image: News Corp Australia
